meanings.sent1: He was thrusting the door open with all his might.
meanings.sent2: The knight was thrusting his sword into the enemy's shield.
meanings.sent3: The chef was thrusting the vegetables into the boiling pot.
meanings.sent4: The waves were thrusting the boat towards the rocky shore.
meanings.sent5: The worker was thrusting the shovel into the hard ground to dig a hole.

meanings.sent1: The sudden thrusting of the car startled the pedestrians.
meanings.sent2: The rocket's thrusting propelled it into outer space.
meanings.sent3: The cat made a playful thrusting motion towards the toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The gust of wind caused a thrusting of leaves off the tree branches.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's thrusting across the stage captivated the audience.

meanings.definition: The act of using force to move something.
meanings.sent1: The strongman's thrusting of the boulder impressed the crowd.
meanings.sent2: The team's coordinated thrusting of the sled won them the race.
meanings.sent3: The child's thrusting of the toy car down the ramp was full of excitement.
meanings.sent4: The engine's thrusting of the airplane forward signaled takeoff.
meanings.sent5: The worker's thrusting of the lever activated the machinery.
